# AI & Cybersecurity Weekly Briefing

### New ConsentFix attack hijacks Microsoft accounts via Azure CLI


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses a newly identified cybersecurity threat, ConsentFix, which targets Microsoft accounts by exploiting vulnerabilities within the Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI). This attack allows unauthorized access to Microsoft users' accounts, potentially compromising sensitive data and applications. The exploitation occurs through the manipulation of consent grants typically used for legitimate application permissions, enabling attackers to gain elevated privileges. The report emphasizes the growing need for enhanced security measures and user awareness around permission grants within cloud services to prevent unauthorized access and protect critical organizational data.

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/new-consentfix-attack-hijacks-microsoft-accounts-via-azure-cli/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5979)**

### ClickFix Style Attack Uses Grok, ChatGPT for Malware Delivery


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


A recent cyberattack strategy dubbed "ClickFix Style Attack" exploits Grok and ChatGPT for effective malware delivery. This sophisticated method leverages both technologies to deceive users and facilitate the infiltration of malicious software into target systems. By using Grok, attackers are able to establish secure communications channels that are difficult to detect, while ChatGPT assists in crafting convincing phishing messages or automated responses, increasing the likelihood of successful user interaction. This evolving technique highlights the growing integration of advanced AI-driven tools in cybercrime,

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.darkreading.com/vulnerabilities-threats/clickfix-style-attack-grok-chatgpt-malware?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_9818)**

üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article discusses the increasing implementation of age verification measures on the internet, driven by legislative efforts across various regions to protect minors from accessing harmful content. It highlights concerns regarding privacy, digital rights, and the potential for creating barriers to accessing information. In response, the authors have created a resource hub to help individuals understand these changes and advocate for their rights. This hub offers guidance on digital privacy, outlines potential consequences of age verification laws, and provides tools and strategies for resisting unnecessary invasions of privacy while navigating

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/12/age-verification-coming-internet-we-built-you-resource-hub-fight-back?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_4356)**

### EU's New Digital Package Proposal Promises Red Tape Cuts but Guts GDPR Privacy Rights


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The European Union has proposed a new digital package aimed at reducing bureaucratic procedures to streamline business operations, but critics argue it compromises the privacy protections established by the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). While the initiative intends to simplify regulatory compliance for companies, privacy advocates warn that it may erode fundamental rights by relaxing some of the stringent data protection measures currently in place. The proposal has sparked a debate over balancing economic growth with the need to uphold privacy standards, as stakeholders assess the potential impact on both businesses

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/12/eus-new-digital-package-proposal-promises-red-tape-cuts-guts-gdpr-privacy-rights?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_7522)**
